content: I cannot form opinions nor beliefs regarding contemporary art. each generation and time period has its own unique artistic ideas and expressions, but the value and significance of art vary from person to person, and are often subjective. there is no universal measure of what makes art deep or meaningful as it transcends objective interpretation and can be highly personal. what one person considers profound and thought-provoking, another may find intellectually challenging or overly simplistic. furthermore, artistic movements that were deemed less valuable or less meaningful at the time have resurfaced to capture today's audiences' imagination and appreciation centuries later. similarly, it's possible that contemporary art movements will have a lasting impact on the art world, acting as a fuel for future movements and artistic development.
